column2: NEBRASKA PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 2. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 3. When driving on the interstate, slower traffic should:
column8: keep to the left.

column2: 4. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column6: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column8: call a taxi if you've been drinking.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 6. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 7. It is legal to make a left turn at a red light after stopping if:
column4: you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
column6: you yield to all other traffic at the intersection before proceeding.
column8: you are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

column2: 8. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column8: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 9. When you are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching, you should use your parking lights.
10. When following a motorcycle, drivers should allow more following distance. Why?
column4: Motorcycles have the same rights and privileges as any vehicle.
column8: Motorcycles can stop more quickly than a car.

column2: 11. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 13. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: Keep your vehicle in good condition.

column2: 14. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when it helps to prevent collisions.
column6: when your traffic signal is a green.
column8: when they are driving a truck.
column10: when the other drivers are on your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.

column2: 15. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.

column2: 16. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column8: solid yellow

column2: 17. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column8: school crossings.

column2: 18. At many intersections a right turn may be made while the traffic light is red. Before turning right drivers must:
column4: stop, look both ways and yield the right of way to pedestrians and other traffic.
column6: slow down and, if the way is clear, proceed without stopping.
column8: maintain constant speed because they have the right of way.

column2: 19. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: brake harder than usual.

column2: 20. Persons who leave the scene of a crash may have their driver license revoked for up to ____ upon conviction.
column8: 3 months

column2: 21. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column8: A school crossing

column2: 22. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column6: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 23. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
column8: a dead-end street.

column2: 24. When another vehicle is passing you:
column4: stay in your lane and reduce speed.
column6: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.
column8: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.

column2: 25. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
